message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV

Reasoning: The paper deals with word embeddings and their evaluation using Wasserstein distances for cross-lingual document retrieval and classification tasks. This falls under the domain of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML), which are covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely category as it specifically deals with NLP. cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely categories as they cover ML and AI, which are relevant to the paper. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another possible category as it deals with retrieval tasks. Finally, cs.CV (Computer Vision) is a less likely category, but it could be relevant if the paper deals with visual embeddings or image-based retrieval/classification tasks.
